intro: Spiloxene dielsiana, commonly known as the Diels' spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. It has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Spiloxene dielsiana is known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in some botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
